intro: Weinmannia subsessiliflora f. novogranatensis, commonly known as the Colombian weinmannia, is a shrub or small tree native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is characterized by its alternate,革质 (leathery) leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody, spherical fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
